intro: Aspilia mossambicensis, commonly known as the African torch flower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in open grasslands and rocky soils. The plant features a tall, erect stem with narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of yellowish-white flowers. Its botanical characteristics include a fibrous root system and a distinct, branched inflorescence. Aspilia mossambicensis is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
